sweets.name: Snickers
sweets.history: Snickers was created in 1930 by Mars, Incorporated...
sweets.flavorProfile: A satisfying blend of nougat, caramel, and peanuts, coated in milk chocolate...
sweets.trivia: The bar was named after the Mars family's favorite horse.

sweets.name: Ferrero Rocher
sweets.history: Introduced in 1982 by Italian chocolatier Ferrero...
sweets.flavorProfile: A whole roasted hazelnut encased in a thin wafer shell filled with hazelnut cream...
sweets.trivia: 'Rocher' means 'rock' or 'boulder' in French, likely referring to its shape.
sweets.brandStory: Ferrero's marketing has always positioned Rocher as a luxury, yet accessible, confection...

sweets.name: Macaron
sweets.history: The modern Parisian macaron was popularized in the early 20th century...
sweets.flavorProfile: Almond meringue shells with ganache or jam filling...

sweets.name: Gummy Bears
sweets.history: Invented by Hans Riegel Sr., founder of Haribo...

sweets.name: Cannoli
sweets.history: Cannoli originated in Sicily during the Arab rule of the island...
sweets.flavorProfile: Crispy fried pastry tubes filled with sweet ricotta cheese, often with chocolate chips or candied fruit...
sweets.trivia: The name 'cannoli' means 'little tubes' in Italian.

sweets.name: Mon Chéri
sweets.history: Created by Ferrero in 1956, Mon Chéri is a premium chocolate praline...
sweets.flavorProfile: Dark chocolate shell filled with cherry liqueur and a whole cherry...
sweets.trivia: The name means 'my dear' in French, reflecting its romantic positioning.
sweets.brandStory: Mon Chéri is marketed as a sophisticated adult chocolate, often given as gifts.

sweets.name: Pizzelle
sweets.history: Pizzelle are traditional Italian waffle cookies that originated in the Abruzzo region...
sweets.flavorProfile: Thin, crispy waffle cookies with delicate anise or vanilla flavoring...
sweets.trivia: The name comes from 'pizze', meaning 'round and flat' in Italian.
